Package oop.ex5.main

Class GlobalVariablesChecker

java.lang.Object
oop.ex5.main.GlobalVariablesChecker
public class GlobalVariablesChecker extends Object
A singleton class with the responsibility of checking variables declarations, assignments and conditions, when appeared before their actual declaration or initialization in the global scope.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static List<String>
    globalVariablesAssignments
    A list of Strings which holds all possible variables assignments from Method scopes.
    static HashMap<String,​Scope>
    globalVariablesCondition
    A map which holds all possible condition Strings, with their Sconditions scopes from which they created.
    static List<String>
    globalVariablesDeclaration
    A list of Strings which holds all possible variables declarations from Method scopes.

    Description

    addAssignment​(String assignment)
    This method adds a possible global scope assignment to the relevant list.

    This method adds a possible global scope condition to the relevant map.
    static void

    This method adds a possible global scope declaration to the relevant list.
    static void
    checkGlobalAssignments()
    This method iterates over all possible variables assignments (from Method scopes), and checks if the variable was declared in the global scope after the assignments.
    static void
    checkGlobalCondition()
    This method checks if all possible condition (with the use of global scope variables) are valid.
    static void
    checkGlobalDeclaration()
    This method iterates over all possible variables declarations (from Method scopes), and checks if the variable was declared and initialized in the global scope after the declaration.

  • Field Details

    • globalVariablesAssignments

      public static List<String> globalVariablesAssignments
      A list of Strings which holds all possible variables assignments from Method scopes.

    • globalVariablesDeclaration

      public static List<String> globalVariablesDeclaration
      A list of Strings which holds all possible variables declarations from Method scopes.

    • globalVariablesCondition

      public static HashMap<String,​Scope> globalVariablesCondition
      A map which holds all possible condition Strings, with their Sconditions scopes from which they created.

  • Method Details

    • addAssignment

      public static void addAssignment​(String assignment)
      This method adds a possible global scope assignment to the relevant list.
      Parameters:
      assignment - A string contains the relevant assignment.

    • addDeclaration

      public static void addDeclaration​(String declaration)
      This method adds a possible global scope declaration to the relevant list.
      Parameters:
      declaration - A string contains the relevant declaration.

    • addCondition

      public static void addCondition​(String condition, Scope scope)
      This method adds a possible global scope condition to the relevant map.
      Parameters:
      condition - A string contains the relevant condition.
      scope - The scope from which the condition was created.

    • checkGlobalAssignments

      public static void checkGlobalAssignments() throws VariableError
      This method iterates over all possible variables assignments (from Method scopes), and checks if the variable was declared in the global scope after the assignments.
      Throws:
      VariableError - In case the assignment is invalid.

    • checkGlobalDeclaration

      public static void checkGlobalDeclaration() throws oop.ex5.main.InvalidCommand, oop.ex5.main.InvalidMethodCall, VariableError, oop.ex5.main.InvalidSyntax
      This method iterates over all possible variables declarations (from Method scopes), and checks if the variable was declared and initialized in the global scope after the declaration.
      Throws:
      oop.ex5.main.InvalidCommand - In case the declaration command in wrong.
      oop.ex5.main.InvalidMethodCall - In case the call was done not from a method scope.
      VariableError - In case the assignment is invalid.
      oop.ex5.main.InvalidSyntax - In case there is a problem with the declaration syntax.

    • checkGlobalCondition

      public static void checkGlobalCondition() throws VariableError, ScopeError
      This method checks if all possible condition (with the use of global scope variables) are valid.
      Throws:
      VariableError - In case the condition is of a bad s-Java condition type.
      ScopeError - In case of an invalid s-Java condition.
